title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Multiple manhole explosions on Newbury Street caused evacuations from Gloucester Street to Dartmouth Street in Boston.
The incidents led to street closures, including Newbury between Exeter and Clarendon, and Dartmouth between Boylston and Commonwealth.
No injuries were reported, and the explosions are believed to be the result of an electrical issue.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station's new fare gates remain out of service since a major snowstorm hit Boston over a week ago.
The gates, installed in December, were shut down before the storm to protect them but were still impacted by snow.
The MBTA is working with Keolis and Scheidt & Bachmann to restore functionality to the $3.3 million fare gates.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the mentality of the 2025 Patriots, acknowledging differences from past championship teams.
Mike Vrabel and Devin McCourty both highlight changes since the Tom Brady era but note similar foundational success.
McCourty, now with NBC, enjoys the current Patriots' Super Bowl run and remains supportive of their efforts.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, pleaded guilty to five charges related to posing as a student at Boston high schools.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years probation, must pay over $9,000 restitution, and is barred from Boston Public Schools.
Hewitt used aliases to enroll at three schools during 2022-2023, creating fake documents to maintain her deception.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools imposed a partial hiring freeze due to a $53 million budget deficit for the current fiscal year.
The School Committee voted to close three schools by 2027, potentially affecting 300-400 educator positions.
Budget issues are driven by increased health insurance, transportation, and food service costs, lacking federal COVID relief funds.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell entertains Patriots teammates with SNL-style 'Weekend Updates' during Friday film sessions, improving team morale.
Campbell went viral after humorously chugging a beer at a Celtics game, showcasing his comedic side off the field.
Despite injury setbacks, Campbell has been vital to the Patriots' offensive line, helping improve their performance this season.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Mela Rosario, 17, from Dorchester is missing; last seen at Brockton courthouse, according to Boston Police.
Rosario was reported missing Thursday night after not returning home; last contact with family was 11:30 a.m. Thursday.
Rosario described as 5'1", brown skin, medium build; last seen in pink jacket, black leggings, and brown Ugg boots.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty expressed confusion and disappointment over their exclusion, calling it a 'travesty' and 'ridiculous'.
Kraft and Belichick were on a five-person ballot with L.C. Greenwood, Roger Craig, and Ken Anderson.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics trade Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to Chicago Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
The trade helps the Celtics reduce their luxury tax penalty from $39.5 million to $17.7 million.
Vučević adds scoring and rebounding to Boston's frontcourt, averaging 16.9 points, 9 rebounds per game this season.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Robert Kraft not voted into Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026, missing out on a gold jacket.
Mike Vrabel called Kraft 'more than deserving' of Hall of Fame induction, expressing appreciation for their relationship.
If Patriots win Super Bowl LX, they'll tie the Packers for most playoff wins in history at 37.
